title: Why the fuck is Jhin out running Hecarim right now?
body:
{{item:3095}} {{item:3009}} {{item:3094}} and fleet footwork/hail of blades means he's running at 623 fucking movement speed every auto attack. Why the fuck hasn't this been nerfed yet? Why do I have to wait another 2 weeks for this to be addressed, better yet, IF it gets addressed? 

No wonder people can't fucking take you seriously right now, a champion is not only running at me faster than champion in the game, but he's meant to be immobile, plus he's doing a fuck ton of damage. Like I just played against one last game, where he auto'd a minion and straight up ran away like he has ghost.

Why? It's like the balance team are being paid to jack themselves off all day.

replies.body:
I usually spank people asking for nerfs, but this one, I agree with.

Not to mention supports who grant him even more MS {{champion:37}} {{champion:267}} {{champion:43}} {{champion:26}}

Could he be the legend of _The Fast_...?

{{champion:202}} {{summoner:6}} {{item:3095}} {{item:3094}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3085}}  {{item:3009}}
He is the fast
does that mean you guys won't change anything on his kit?

Personal opinion (not on balance team).  

In regards to THE FAST.  I agree that he feels "off" right now, a bit too fast.   IMO Hail of Blades could use some work, seems like a rune that is warping on Jhin while being pretty hard to take advantage of for the rest of the roster.  

That said, stats wise, Jhin doesn't seem OP.  His winrate is average, his pick/ban status in pro seems healthy, he's not highly banned in solo queue.

His pickrate is high however, but we see threads like this pop up all the time on boards whenever a champ is popular.  When you see something in a lot of your games you tend to start noticing the things that might feel BS about it. 

Here's something to think about.  League balance is like a ladder. There's ALWAYS going to be a popular champion that you see a lot at the top of the ladder.  When you nerf bat them off the top, another champion is likely to take their place.  If it isn't Jhin it will be MF, or Draven, or Kai'sa, or Jinx, etc.  A good question to ask is, "who would you rather see at the top of the ladder? Who makes the game best when you see them in your games?"  There's always going to be someone who's played the most.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot jinxylord,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=i1cNNNA3,comment-id=00000000000400000000,timestamp=2018-09-04T08:37:09.837+0000)
>
> Personal opinion (not on balance team).  
> 
> In regards to THE FAST.  I agree that he feels "off" right now, a bit too fast.   IMO Hail of Blades could use some work, seems like a rune that is warping on Jhin while being pretty hard to take advantage of for the rest of the roster.  

That's because the design of it is arbitrary for what it does. Autoing 3 times really quickly isn't something most champions want or need to do to kill somebody quickly in today's league of legends. 

> 
> That said, stats wise, Jhin doesn't seem OP.  His winrate is average, his pick/ban status in pro seems healthy, he's not highly banned in solo queue.

> 
> His pickrate is high however, but we see threads like this pop up all the time on boards whenever a champ is popular.  When you see something in a lot of your games you tend to start noticing the things that might feel BS about it. 


This means nothing when a main point of the balance team's argument has always been "You shouldn't use statistics when determining what is broken and what isn't". The fact that not every Jhin player is good enough to take full advantage of this broken interaction doesn't mean its not a broken interaction. If Jhin had a much lower play rate, he would statistically have a much higher win rate, due to the sheer fact that much, MUCH less people would be losing on him. You want to know how I know this? Because even with a winrate that you would consider normal for a champion, complaints about Jhin are spreading like wildfire.


> 
> Here's something to think about.  League balance is like a ladder. There's ALWAYS going to be a popular champion that you see a lot at the top of the ladder.  When you nerf bat them off the top, another champion is likely to take their place.  If it isn't Jhin it will be MF, or Draven, or Kai'sa, or Jinx, etc.  A good question to ask is, "who would you rather see at the top of the ladder? Who makes the game best when you see them in your games?"  There's always going to be someone who's played the most.


Here's something else to think about. Before, it was very rarely one champion warping the game.  But even if it was, you could ban it and the rest of the roster would range from below average to above average. Why? Because the CHAMPION was broken fundamentally. It wasn't a combination of items and runes/masteries, it was the champion itself. Today? You can't find a single damn champion that people call broken that got to that point based on just existing. It's ALWAYS items/runes now. You nerf those broken items but then replace those nerfs with buffs to other items (OR THE SAME DAMN ITEM, DUSKBLADE HELLO?). A good question to ask is, "when did this game start to revolve around the items you build and not the champion you pick?" What items ruin the game the worst when you see them built?" There's always going to be broken items because that's the MO now.

Dude, I think you need to turn it down a bit. First, this guy isn't on the balance team so your words accomplish nothing. Second, it's aggressive comments like this that turn rioters off from talking to the community.

Wtf are you talking about?

There was nothing wrong with this guys post.he wasn't being aggressive or toxic,he simply replied to to the rioter. It may not accomplish anything,but who says you can only reply if it accomplishes somthing?he may have just wanted to get his opinion heard. Being a rioter dosent mean people should bend knees for them.

 Jbels didn't even imply jinxylord was on the balancr team,he simply stated his opinion.

Uhhhhh just a quick list of champs that are broken based on their kits:

Zoe, Yasuo, new Akali, Zed.

Yes, the main reason Zed is broken is Duskblade and Electrocute.  Yasuo is broken because True Damage on IE and Conqueror, but the other ones are just a tiltfest.  If I see them on the enemy team I might as well dodge because I know I won't have fun with them in the game.  That's more of a fundamental problem with the game than "X champ is strong qq"

I have a question : what are ashe or kog maw supposed to do against jhin ? The new champions you create have complete kits that allows them to be better at everything than older champions is that what you want to do ? outdate old champions ?

Wow, i take back what i said you didn't ignore a current problem

>That said, stats wise, Jhin doesn't seem OP. His winrate is average, his pick/ban status in pro seems healthy, he's not highly banned >in solo queue.

he's not highly banned because plat players hate zed more, but it doesn't  matter balance wise
**he has the triple of an adc pick rate with 52% win rate** 

HOW THE HELL IS THAT FINE?????

>in regards to THE FAST. I agree that he feels "off" right now, a bit too fast. IMO Hail of Blades could use some work, seems like a rune >that is warping on Jhin while being pretty hard to take advantage of for the rest of the roster.

then fix him, hail of blades or not  the issue needs to be fixed directly or indirectly

You realize it isn't an issue that he has a high pick rate if his win ratio and stat isn't over the line?

If anything, it mean other ADC are too weak OR that he is just very fun to play (which he is, he is an easy way to play ADC in my eyes and his kit is satisfying to use).
There is always popular champ and kids, Jhin was ALWAYS super popular bot when he is good (not op, just when he isn't trash).

> [{quoted}](name=Nevrankroaton,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=i1cNNNA3,comment-id=0000000000040000000000010001,timestamp=2018-09-04T11:11:35.754+0000)

> 
> If anything, it mean other ADC are too weak OR that he is just very fun to play (which he is, he is an easy way to play ADC in my eyes and his kit is satisfying to use).
> There is always popular champ and kids, Jhin was ALWAYS super popular bot when he is good (not op, just when he isn't trash).

The fact that his playright is so high dampens his winrate. There are way more people losing on Jhin because they're bad at him/at the game despite picking him because they heard he was broken.

52% win rate is off the line
it's in no way fine

https://lolalytics.com/fra/ranked/worldwide/platinum/plus/grid/
https://i.gyazo.com/d8c44f14954462cfa40773e35c9efb58.png
>If anything, it mean other ADC are too weak

again this argument that i need 15 min to completly destroy
but i will save my precious time today
so yea adcs are weak if that's what you wish to argue for
Higher play rates equals higher winrates. 28% (Lolalytics) pickrate with a 52% winrate is a large difference from a 52% winrate with a less than 1% pickrate.

> [{quoted}](name=AwesomeGuyDj,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=i1cNNNA3,comment-id=00000000000400000000000100010002,timestamp=2018-09-04T14:44:03.720+0000)
>
> Higher play rates equals higher winrates. 28% (Lolalytics) pickrate with a 52% winrate is a large difference from a 52% winrate with a less than 1% pickrate.

It's the other way around, actually. Having a higher play rate means larger sample size of games, which means the win rate should be closer to 50%. The exception to this is if the champion is extremely mechanically intensive, like Lee Sin. EDIT: In which case the winrate would likely be lower than the champions real potential would suggest. Or, if the champion is too strong, then a massive play rate and high winrate would occur.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot jinxylord,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=i1cNNNA3,comment-id=000000000004,timestamp=2018-09-04T04:55:54.912+0000)
>
> He is the fast

Oh come on.

We finally get a response from Riot and it doesn't even address the original problem in the post.

Let me guess, gotta keep Jhin OP for Worlds.

(UPDATE NOTE: This was posted before the Rioter posted their constructed feedback/opinion on the situation).

I'm honestly surprised that some people actually expected for a Rioter (even now) to give their initial thoughts on the current state of Jhin or any other issue currently.

To be honest, Jinxlord shouldn't of made that comment or any Rioter (as specially now) if the comment wasn't a serious contructed opinion on the subject that the OP is covering. But I knew that this is how people would of reacted.

To anyone reading this, i've given up on this sexist company that we know as Riot Games, and the game itself. I will not play a game which the company cares little for, or a company of the game which doesn't take anything seriously for the sake of professionalism.

I've had some respect to Riot before this whole sexism drama but after all that has happened i've lost it all and they don't deserve it. I'm just done with them and their toxic designed game along with part of the community that is toxic and still praise Riot regardless of what they do.

Time to move on and play something else where the company or developers of the game actually are able to accept a decently sized feedback from it's players, or those who actually give regular thoughts on people's posts instead of looking at the top posts with the most upvotes. And even improve parts of the game where they see people's opinions patterned towards a specific problem in the game.

that has nothing to do with this and jinxylord hasn't said anything related to the whole shitfest afaik. If a random rioter isn't allowed to meme anymore maybe they should just never talk to us at all.

there's no point attacking him or anyone who hasn't made themselves look like a degenerate such as DzK.

If you took your time you'd see he's stated his opinion on it wether you like it or not, he gave you exactly what you wanted.

Sexist? The idea that Jhin isn't being nerfed because of a gender issue is so dumb that it actually makes me want to slam my head in a meat grinder. I'm going to just take a shot in the dark to say that's just a virtue signal and move on. "Virtue! Virtue! look at me everybody, I'm a good progressive person". The hiring scandal was nothing but anecdotal evidence by a handful of people, most of which anonymous and unverifiable (convenient when a progressive agenda is being pushed). But more importantly, it has absolutely nothing to do with Jhin, the balance team, move-speed, or anything the OP posted about.

Yup, Stormrazor is removing his main weakness.

He's meant to be immobile thus vulnerable to champions who can get on to him with mobility spells.


Right now, if he see's an Assassin/Bruiser/Diver/Mobile marksman diving him all he has to do is right click once and run away at mach 12 speeds.

fleetfootwork is fine imo, hail of blades just needs to be removed/replaced. Jhin was a subpar adc until they introduced both stormrazor and hail of blades at the same time. It's not jhin that's the problem.

> [{quoted}](name=SpongebobIsLife,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=i1cNNNA3,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2018-09-03T16:11:06.843+0000)

Its defenitely jhin that is the problem, since no other adc in the game can abuse both of those as hard.

Its his passive MS conversion that is broken.
no other adc runs hail  of blades either.

> [{quoted}](name=SpongebobIsLife,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=i1cNNNA3,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2018-09-03T16:11:06.843+0000)
>
> fleetfootwork is fine imo, hail of blades just needs to be removed/replaced. Jhin was a subpar adc until they introduced both stormrazor and hail of blades at the same time. It's not jhin that's the problem.

Jhin was not subpar before Stormrazor.

He was viable, not broken and certainly not underpowered.

At the moment he's broken.

Many ADC's rely on Stormrazor right now and are not a balance issue.

**Jhin simply needs a passive change that prevents the movement speed bonus from activating if the Critical Strike is from Stormrazor.**


They have the technology to make spells/abilities not interact with specific items.

Kai'Sa Supercharge (E) cooldown reduction mechanic does not interact with Runaan's Hurricane.
Caitlyn's Headshot (P) does not interact with Runaan's Hurricane.
Vayne's Silver Bolts (W) does not interact with Runaan's Hurricane.

> [{quoted}](name=Antenora,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=i1cNNNA3,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2018-09-03T16:21:37.022+0000)
>
> Vayne's Silver Bolts (W) does not interact with Runaan's Hurricane.

Runaan's interacts with on-hits. Vayne's W applies a stacking debuff that procs at max stacks.
